com.camerontec.util.datamodel

Class MessageFactoryBuilder<T extends Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.datamodel.MessageFactoryBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The concrete message class.

    public final class MessageFactoryBuilder<T extends Message>
extends Object
    Utility class for building pre-configured message factories.

    Depending on the options chosen, this class returns an instance of either:

    • UnpooledMessageFactory, OR
    • PooledMessageFactory
    However, it is possible to construct message factories, and therefore messages, without explicitly using either class. A typical usage is as follows: 
       MessageFactory<MyMessage> factory = new MessageFactoryBuilder(MyMessage.class)
     .withDecoder(...)
     .withInitialFieldPerMessageCapacity(int) withInitialFieldPerMessageCapacity(...)}
     .withInitialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity(int) withInitialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity(...)}
     .withMinMessagePoolCapacity(...)
     .build()
    As required by ReflectiveMessageFactory the concrete message class, in this case MyMessage, must have a constructor with the following signature: 
       MyMessage(FieldGroup, MessageFactory)
    See Also:
    UnpooledMessageFactory, PooledMessageFactory

    • Method Detail

      • withDecoder

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withDecoder(Decoder<ByteArrayView> decoder)
        Set the Decoder to be injected into all byte array fields (if applicable).

        A field decoder is only required when fields require conversion from an external representation (e.g. fields and field groups associated with messages received off the wire).

        Parameters:
        decoder - The decoder.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • withInitialFieldPerMessageCapacity

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withInitialFieldPerMessageCapacity(int initialFieldPerMessageCapacity)
        Set the initial field per root field group capacity.

        Since FieldGroup is an OrderedCollection, then it is a container of fields. This value is used to to give an initial capacity for the associated internal backing store. Note that this is not strictly necessary because internal backing stores grow on demand, however, in some contexts providing initial capacities is more efficient since it reduces the frequency of backing store resizing.

        There is a differentiation between the field capacity of the so the so called root field group and nested field groups. This is to allow for a bias towards the one or the other as required.

        Parameters:
        initialFieldPerMessageCapacity - The initial field per message capacity.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • withInitialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withInitialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity(int initialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity)
        Set the initial field group per field group capacity.

        Since Field is an OrderedCollection, then it is a container of field groups. This value is used to to give an initial capacity for the associated internal backing store. Note that this is not strictly necessary because internal backing stores grow on demand, however, in some contexts providing initial capacities is more efficient since it reduces the frequency of backing store resizing.

        Parameters:
        initialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity - The initial field group per field capacity.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • withFieldValueClass

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withFieldValueClass(Class<? extends FieldValue> fieldValueClass)
        Supply a preferred concrete FieldValue class.

        By default, concrete fields are instances of AnyFieldValue.

        Parameters:
        fieldValueClass - The field class.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • withMinimalAllocation

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withMinimalAllocation()
        Use a minimal allocation policy for growing the size of the collection of fields.

        By default, the size is doubled whenever it exceeds it capacity. If this property is set then the size is only increased by one.

        Returns:
        This object.

      • withPooling

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withPooling()
        Enable message, field group and field pooling.

        With just this option pooling is enabled and default pool sizes are chosen. It is highly recommended that explicit pool sizes are chosen via withMinMessagePoolCapacity(int) (int)}, withInitialFieldPerMessageCapacity(int) and withInitialFieldGroupPerMessageCapacity(int).

        Returns:
        This object.

      • withMinMessagePoolCapacity

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withMinMessagePoolCapacity(int minMessagePoolCapacity)
        Enable resource pooling and set the minimum message pool capacity.

        The actual pool size is guaranteed to be at least that specified and most likely the next power of two.

        This option implies withPooling().

        Parameters:
        minMessagePoolCapacity - The minimum message pool capacity.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • withPooledReclaimerThreadWaitScheme

        public MessageFactoryBuilder<T> withPooledReclaimerThreadWaitScheme(String waitScheme)
        Set the MessageFactoryProperties.POOLED_RECLAIMER_THREAD_WAIT_SCHEME value.
        Parameters:
        waitScheme - The wait scheme.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • build

        public MessageFactory<T> build()
        Build the message factory.

        This method is only suitable when the message class has a constructor with the following signature: 

           MyMessage(FieldGroup, MessageFactory)
        Returns:
        The message factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the message class does not have a conforming constructor.
